course_title: Fresh Sem: NBB: Illusions and Reaction Times
class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
(How much can we infer about the workings of the brain without actually getting into the brain? This class examines ways in which perceptual illusions and reaction times have been used to study perception and information processing. We will design and perform simple experiments together and you will do two small projects. Most of the class will be discussion-based, with no textbook.)
course_description: Fall, spring. Variable topics of special interest in the field of Neuroscience and Behavioral Biology. Any of these NBB 190 courses will satisfy the new General Education freshman seminar requirement but will not count as an NBB elective.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 3926, Section #: 3, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:40-3:55p, Instructor: R. Wyttenbach, Status: Closed
